title: Fellows Park
text:
Fellows Park was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Walsall">Walsall</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. It was the home ground of <a href="Walsall%20F.C.">Walsall F.C.</a> from 1896 until 1990, when the team moved to the <a href="Bescot%20Stadium">Bescot Stadium</a>.
Fellows Park was situated about a quarter of a mile away from the club's present ground, The Bescot Stadium, at the junction of Hilary Street and Wallows Lane.
The club moved to the ground from <a href="West%20Bromwich%20Road">West Bromwich Road</a> in 1896. Until 1930 it was named Hilary Street, at which point it was renamed after H.L. Fellows, a club director. Walsall's record home attendance was at Fellows Park, when 25,453 spectators were present for the team's Second Division match against <a href="Newcastle%20United">Newcastle United</a> on 29 August 1961.
By March 1988, the club was planning to build a new stadium at nearby Bescot Crescent. Within two years, construction work was underway at the new stadium site and the last league game at Fellows Park was played on 1 May 1990, when Walsall, in the process of their second successive relegation which took them into the <a href="Football%20League%20Fourth%20Division">Football League Fourth Division</a>, drew 1–1 at home to <a href="Rotherham%20United%20F.C.">Rotherham United</a>, with <a href="Andy%20Dornan">Andy Dornan</a> scoring the last league goal at the ground – his only goal in his time at Walsall.
The final game played at the ground was on 11 May 1990, when retiring defender <a href="Peter%20Hart%20%28footballer%29">Peter Hart's</a> testimonial was held there with local rivals <a href="West%20Bromwich%20Albion%20F.C.">West Bromwich Albion</a> providing the opposition. This game also ended in a 1–1 draw, with <a href="Gary%20Shaw%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201961%29">Gary Shaw</a> scoring an equaliser for Walsall in the 37th minute, thus going down in history as the last player to score at the stadium, in its 94-year history. The new <a href="Bescot%20Stadium">Bescot Stadium</a> was ready for the <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20in%20English%20football">1990–91 season</a>. A reminder of Fellows Park remains in the new stadium, in the name of the H.L. Fellows Stand. The old stadium was demolished in early 1991 and a <a href="Morrisons">Morrisons</a> supermarket built on the site.
In December 1990, several weeks before the stadium's demolition, heavy snow caused the roof of the "cowshed" section of the stadium to collapse.
